description:
Nova appears to store the adminPass in the database. See below where the adminPass returned from the OSAPI matches the 'admin_pass' in the instances table:

-----

root@nova1:~# nova boot --image 3 --flavor 2 test
+-----------+--------------------------------------+
|  Property |                Value                 |
+-----------+--------------------------------------+
| adminPass | sQ6yiSzJwTwaJGEM                     |
| created   | 2011-08-16T18:45:17Z                 |
| flavor    | m1.small                             |
| hostId    |                                      |
| id        | 1                                    |
| image     | ami-tty                              |
| metadata  | {}                                   |
| name      | test                                 |
| progress  | 0                                    |
| status    | BUILD                                |
| updated   | 2011-08-16T18:45:17Z                 |
| uuid      | 57f84094-3e98-44d6-8005-2eeff3ab9f1e |
+-----------+--------------------------------------+

mysql> select admin_pass from instances;
+------------------+
| admin_pass       |
+------------------+
| sQ6yiSzJwTwaJGEM |
+------------------+

------------

We should not be storing in the clear admin passwords in the database.
title: nova stores adminPass in the database
